availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky native. Son of Thomas S. and Sally W. Theobald. Married to Susan C. Moffitt Theobald in Trimble County, Kentucky on June 9, 1845. Father of Griffin Theobald, Robert M. Theobald, Henry K. Theobald, Sally T. Theobald, Bettie Theobald, and Susan Theobald. Clerk in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Frankfort in 1860. Served in the U.S. Army Volunteers as a clerk and paymaster from 1861 to 1865. Employed George Williams as a house servant in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trimble County Marriages, Film #000420389.
Find A Grave, "Thomas A. Theobald (1821-1923)," Memorial #64378131, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64378131 (accessed July 24, 2019).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 33A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 396.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, Milton, p. 228B.
